title: The Hello World
text:
Hello World
This is a test post.

title: Hi, I’m Nathaniel Phillips, PhD
text:
I’m Nathaniel Phillips, PhD, I’m known for R Piratery, data science applications in healthcare, and decision making research.
This website is a place for me to jot down my professional and personal reflections, namely while I’m on an extended parental leave.
Check out my About, Resources, and Blog pages

Contact
Here’s how you can reach me:

Email: nathaniel.d.phillips.is@gmail.com
LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/nathanieldphillips
GitHub: www.github.com/ndphillips

title: Resources
text: Here are some of my favorite resources

title: Resources
text:
Books
Here are some of my favorite books



Title
Author
Tag
Note




The Design of Everyday Things
Donald A. Norman
Design
As applicable to programming as it is to the design of toilets


The First 90 Days
Michael D. Watkins
Management
A great resource for anyone starting a new job - recommended by Lura Long


The Checklist Manifesto
Atul Gawande
Medicine
Gawande is one of my favorite writers at the intersection of science and medicine.


How big things get done
Bent Flyvbjerg, Dan Gardner
Project Management
Should be required reading for anyone working on projects with teams - recommended by Nicole Mirea


R for Data Science
Hadley Wickham, Garrett Grolemund
R
A great resource for learning R


Writing R Packages
Hadley Wickham
R
The bible of R package development


It
Stephen King
Fiction
I just wish they would print it in two separate volumes
